alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 1:11PM MST until January 11 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Southwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Winds switch around to the north by sunrise Thursday and decrease in intensity. * WHERE...Areas above 3500 feet near Chinle, Fredonia, Jacob Lake, Kayenta, Page and Shonto. * WHEN...From 11 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact Thursday morning`s commute. Patchy blowing snow will likely lead to low visibility. Snow forecast from 11 PM Wednesday to 11 AM Thursday: Chinle 2 to 4 inches Fredonia 0 to 1 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches Kayenta 1 to 2 inches Page 0 to 1 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
